Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the ranking of human trafficking as the third-biggest criminal enterprise in the world.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the ranking of human trafficking as the third-biggest criminal enterprise.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that human trafficking is definitively ranked as the third-biggest criminal enterprise without considering alternative rankings or perspectives.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the existence of alternative rankings or understandings of the scale of different criminal enterprises.
